titleStmt.title: Harry VVhite his humour, so neare as may be set forth by M.P. In which is exprest, both earnest and jest: let honest men buy, and knaves let it lye: this is not for them, vvho vertue contemne[d]
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

publicationStmt.publisher: [By T. Cotes?] for Thomas Lambert, at [the] signe of the Hors-shoo in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Suggested printer's name and publication date from STC.

Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
